Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 552-3662.

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?

III. METHODOLOGY
02/22/2021 Special Investigation Intake
2021C0103014
02/23/2021 Special Investigation Initiated - Telephone
Zoom meeting with FC Worker, Facility, and Youth A to go over
safety plan.
02/24/2021 Inspection Completed On-site
This visit was conducted virtually due to COVID-19. Youth A,
therapist, Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3 and the CA were all interviewed.
02/24/2021 Exit Conference
02/24/2021 Inspection Completed-BCAL Sub. Compliance
ALLEGATION:
On 2/22/21, a youth was being physically aggressive. Staff member placed youth in
an incorrect containment hold.
INVESTIGATION:
A complaint was received on 2/22/21 stating while Youth A was being aggressive,
he was placed in a containment hold (restraint). Staff 1 placed Youth A in an
incorrect hold. Youth A was laying on his back with his arms across his chest while
Staff 1 was pushing down on Youth A. The hold Youth A should have been placed in
was a Satori hold that is an elbow to hip hold.
Youth A’s case file was reviewed. Youth A has been physically aggressive while at
his current placement. He is diagnosed with FASD, ADHD, unspecified mood
disorder, and a developmental disorder.
2

On 2/23/21 the Foster Care Worker (FCW) set up a video call with Youth A and the
facility to go over a safety plan. Due to the facility being under quarantine due to
COVID-19 all meetings were conducted virtually. The FCW and this consultant went
over the safety plan with Youth A and the facility. Staff 1 will not have interaction with
Youth A until the investigation has been completed. Youth A listed off several staff
he can go to and a relative he can call if he is feeling unsafe. Youth A repeated over
and over again how Staff 1 was a bully. He frequently changed the subject to things
he wanted bought for him.
An Incident Report was written by Staff 2. The incident occurred on 2/22/21 at
8:30am. The incident report stated that Youth A was sitting in the staff office with
Staff 2, Staff 3, and his peers when Staff 1 walked in and plugged in his Airpods.
Staff 1 told Youth A "you better not mess with these or else I will mess up your stuff."
Youth A called Staff 1 a bully. Youth A then hit his head on the desk and hit the
computer mouse on the desk. Youth A left the office and walked into the milieu
hallway. Staff wouldn't let him back in the office. Youth A banged his head on the
ground many times and very hard, then he got up and did the same on the walls in
the milieu. He then started hitting the office door. Staff 1 told Youth A "don't do that
or I will contain you." Youth A started crying and yelling. Youth A said Staff 1 was a
bully. Youth A then wrapped his arms around Staff 2's legs. Staff 1 pulled Youth A's
arms off and initiated a containment that was not SATORI approved at 8:41am. Staff
1 had Youth A's arms across Youth A's chest. Youth A was face up and Staff 1 was
on top with Youth A on the bottom. Youth A was crying and Staff 2 told Staff 1 to get
off him. Staff 1 did not acknowledge Staff 2, so Staff 2 asked two more times. Staff 1
then got off of Youth A at 8:44am. Youth A got up and kicked Staff 1 then Staff 2.
Youth A wrapped his arms around Staff 2's legs again and again Staff 1 pulled Youth
A off and initiated an incorrect containment at 8:46am. Staff 1 was on top of Youth A.
Staff 2 told Staff 1 "I got this just get off. Staff 1 let go of Youth A at 8:47am. Youth A
then ran towards Staff 2 and Staff 2 ran around the milieu with him following. Youth
A was not able to outrun staff. Then Staff 2 stopped for a moment and offered Youth
A her hands to squeeze. Youth A grabbed Staff 2's shirt collar, but he was not
pulling or hitting. Staff 1 pulled Youth A off of Staff 2 and told Staff 2 that Youth A
"knows he can get away with this around you guys," referring to Staff 2 and Staff 3.
Staff 1 told Staff 2 to go into the office. Staff 2 went into the office. After 30 minutes
of yelling Youth A de-escalated on his own with Staff 1 present. At 9am Staff 1 told
everyone the unit was clear. Youth A said he wanted to go into the office again. Staff
3 said Youth A had to sit in the milieu with his peer and Staff 1. Youth A asked for
anyone except for Staff 1. He did not want to sit with Staff 1, but he had to sit in the
milieu with Staff 1 to do his school work. The report indicated that Youth A did not
sustain any injuries.
The restraint training materials were reviewed. The restraint method utilized by the
facility is called SATORI. The techniques taught by this training teach staff to hold
youth from the back or side. There is not a technique in which a youth lays on his
back and staff stand or kneel over the youth holding them down from over the top of
them.
3

All interviews took place on 2/24/21. These interviews were conducted virtually due
to COVID-19. The Chief Administrator (CA) sat in on all interviews.
Therapist Interview: The Therapist stated he could provide some insight into the
dynamics of the unit Youth A is on. He stated that the staff on Youth A's unit, C side,
are working on setting better boundaries with the youth. The youth put their hands
on the staff and rather than disengaging they try to de-escalate them in that moment.
When staff from the other units come over and they set those limits it escalates the
youth. This is especially true with Youth A. Staff 1 is an example of a staff who sets
those boundaries. He is more stern and firm which is a different approach than the
other staff. The therapist said he is working with Youth A on this. He tried to debrief
with Youth A but all he would say was that Staff 1 was a bully. Youth A does not
have a lot of restraints.
Youth A Interview: Youth A demonstrated he could follow the rules for Forensic
Interviewing. Youth A stated he lives on C Side. He listed several staff he likes that
work with him. He stated he does not like Staff 1 because Staff 1 stomped on his
foot and his hand. Youth A said he was angry when this happened, and it was not
during a restraint. Staff 1 was hurting his hand by holding it. Staff 1 also blocked
Youth A from getting to Staff 3 and saying goodbye to Staff 3.
Youth A was unable to stay on topic and could not provide any more details.
Staff 2 Interview: Staff 2 reported the kids were in the office and Staff 1 was trying
to plug in his Airpods. Staff 1 told the youth not to mess with his Airpods. Youth A
then hit his peer with a wad of paper. He was prompted to leave the office and Staff
3 guided him out. They would not let him back in the office because he was
aggressive with his peer. Youth A wrapped his arms around Staff 2's legs. Staff 1
pulled Youth A off of Staff 2 and held Youth A by his wrists then placed him in a
containment (restraint). Staff 1 was on his knees next to Youth A while Youth A was
laying on his back. Staff 1 held Youth A's arms crossed over his chest. Staff 1 was
pressing Youth A's arms down onto his chest. Youth A said he could not breath.
Staff 2 told Staff 1 to get off Youth A. He got off Youth A then Youth A began to hit
and kick Staff 2. Staff 1 placed Youth A in another containment holding Youth A the
same way he did previously. Youth A had grabbed Staff 2’s shirt and that is when
Staff 1 told him he should not be out there with Youth A. Staff 2 went into the office
and did not see anything further.
Staff 2 did not think the containment was approved because Youth A was on his
back with Staff 1 kneeling over the top of him rather than Staff 1 being behind Youth
A with Youth A on his side. Also, Youth A's hands were at his shoulders not at his
waist. Staff 2 felt the containment did not need to happen. Youth A was hitting staff
but not hard enough to hurt. They would have been fine without a containment.
Youth A tends to calm down if he runs around the unit with staff. Staff 2 had talked to
Staff 1 after the incident and Staff 1 said he felt Youth A needed to be contained for
Staff 2’s safety. Staff 2 did not see any injuries on Youth A.
4

Staff 2 stated they go over any behavior plans the youth have in team meetings and
discuss any behavioral issues during those meetings. With Youth A they are to hold
his hands and let him squeeze them and have him take deep breaths. These
techniques are communicated to all staff that work with Youth A.
Staff 3 Interview: Staff 3 reported Youth A was in the office and a comment was
made by Staff 1 about not touching his things or there would be issues. Staff 1 said
this jokingly to the youth. Youth A took a computer mouse and slammed it into a
peer’s hand. Youth A was taken out of the office and he grabbed onto her and Staff
2. Staff 1 grabbed Youth A's wrists. Youth A pulled away and began to hit and kick
the staff. Staff 1 still had Youth A's wrists then he put Youth A's arms crossed over
his chest while Youth A was laying on the ground on his back. She stated that Staff
1 was putting pressure on Youth A's chest or abdomen. She stated the containment
was not supposed to be with the youth on his back. When Youth A was calm Staff 1
asked Staff 3 to talk to Youth A. Youth A told her Staff 1 was bullying him. Youth A
told her Staff 1 hurt his wrist and hands but she could not tell if it was from the
containment or from Youth A harming himself as he has scratches all over his hands
from self-harming. Youth A's stomach was red and a mark was on his forehead from
him banging his head.
Staff 3 stated that Youth A has an issue with men in general not just Staff 1. Youth A
says all male staff bully him. Staff 1 jokes around with the kids but Youth A cannot
handle the joking.
Staff 1 Interview: When Staff 1 walked into the office and plugged in his Airpods he
was playing around with another youth about not touching his Airpods. Youth A then
attacked Staff 2. Staff 1 sat back and let Staff 2 handle it. When Youth A grabbed
Staff 2's collar Staff 1 stepped between them. Staff 1 tried to get Youth A's hands off
of Staff 2's collar. Staff 2 ran around with Youth A. Youth A then laid on the floor and
wrapped his arms around Staff 2's legs. Youth A tried to bite Staff 2 so Staff 1
stepped in and removed Youth A from Staff 2's legs. Youth A was on his knees at
first then flopped onto his back on the floor. Staff 1 was standing over Youth A while
holding Youth A's arms across Youth A's chest. Staff 1 told Staff 2 to go to the office
since he was the target of Youth A's aggression. When Staff 2 went into the office he
let go of Youth A. Youth A did say he could not breath while he was laying on the
floor and Staff 1 was holding him. Staff 1 then let Youth A go. Staff 1 stated he was
not putting any pressure on Youth A's chest. He was holding Youth A's wrists at
Youth A's sides. Youth A was not hurt.
Staff 1 reported he has been on C side for about a month and he is not familiar with
Youth A's behavior plan. He is the staff that they call when they cannot handle a
situation. The other staff do not let him deal with Youth A to let him build rapport with
him.
5

An exit conference was held with the CA. She indicated that the same staff deal with
the same kids so not all staff would be familiar with Youth A's behavior plan, but all
staff are supposed to review the youth's treatment plan. They are working on
changing the dynamics on C side so all staff are on the same page and can support
each other.
Staff 1’s Employee File: Staff 1 was hired on 10/8/18 and had his last restraint
refresher on 10/20/20. He has three disciplines in his file for excessive cell phone
use, leaving shift without permission, and too many breaks leaving staff out of ratio.
APPLICABLE RULE
Rule 1 Prohibition of Prone Restraint; Procedures Involving Other
Restraints in Child Caring Institutions
(2) Resident restraint must be performed in a manner that is
safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity of the
minor child’s behavior, chronological and developmental
age, size, gender, physical condition, medical condition,
psychiatric condition, and personal history, including any
history of trauma, and done in a manner consistent with the
resident’s treatment plan.
ANALYSIS: Staff 2 and Staff 3 both stated Staff 1 had Youth A on his back
with his arms across his chest while Staff 1 pressed down on
Youth A’s arms. Staff 1 did admit that Youth A was on the
ground on his back. This technique has not been approved as
the facility’s restraint technique. Pressing on a youth’s chest is
not a safe way to perform a restraint.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
This is a repeat violation cited under R 400.4159 Resident
restraint during Special Investigation 2019C0223057 with a CAP
accepted on 10/07/19.
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan it is recommended that this
investigation be closed with no further licensing action.
